job_description: Procurement Engineer Staff / Arlington, TX - job post LOCKHEED MARTIN CORPORATION 9,160 reviews Arlington, TX 76018 Full-time, Part-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Part-time Procurement Engineers ensure supply chain mission success. Procurement Engineers will work with Supplier Management Teams to reduce supplier risk throughout all phases of the product lifecycle. The Procurement Engineer acts as a liaison between suppliers and internal cross-functional teams, and are frequently a bridge between technical and non-technical groups. Procurement Engineers will exercise skill in capacity management, requirements management, and process improvement. Additional tasks include supporting Global Supply Chain (GSC) operations and initiatives, to include: participating in or facilitating process improvement or corrective action activities such as controlled builds, production line validation, Process Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (PFMEA), Purchase Order (PO) Kickoff, failure investigations/Root Cause and Corrective Action (RCCA), etc. Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college in a related discipline. Experience with one or more of the following: Supply Chain Management, Procurement, Project Management, Program Management, Production Control, major system testing, supplier/vendor management, Production Operations, manufacturing, machining, assembly Able to effectively communicate and interface with Suppliers, Quality Program Management, Engineering, Supplier Quality Management, Sub-contracts Management Team and Customer Government Representatives Ability to read and interpret drawings and industry specifications Ability to work proactively/self-motivated Ability to obtain a Secret clearance Desired Skills: Background/Degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Industrial Engineering or similar field, or equivalent experience/combined education Green/Black belt certified Experience with PAC-3 program Ability to drive process improvements and/or root cause/corrective actions utilizing quantitative analytical methods Risk Management experience Statement of Work requirements writing Process Analysis and Simulation experience Security Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration. Clearance Level: Secret Other Important Information You Should Know Expression of Interest: By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings. Ability to Work Remotely: Part-time Remote Telework: The employee selected for this position will work part of their work schedule remotely and part of their work schedule at a designated Lockheed Martin facility. The specific weekly schedule will be discussed during the hiring process. Work Schedules: Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits. Schedule for this Position: 4x10 hour day, 3 days off per week Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Quality Engineer Asc - job post LOCKHEED MARTIN CORPORATION 9,160 reviews Fort Worth, TX 76155 Full-time, Part-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Part-time Lockheed Martin Missiles & Fire Control (MFC) is seeking a motivated and driven Supplier Quality Engineer (SQE) for a position based in Fort Worth, TX to provide support to the Guided Multiple Launch Rocket System (GMLRS) Program. The position will require flexible hours with periodic travel to support supplier activity across the United States and onsite lab activities. Responsibilities include: Review documentation related to internal and external manufacturing processes to ensure quality products are delivered to the customer. Support Integrated Product Teams with reviews of quality data and information on yields, schematics, simulations, test data, qualification reports, configuration audits, drawing reviews, rework, scrap, and non-conformance. Support product testing at suppliers. Ability to analyze and resolve process issues varying from basic to very complex. Attend and lead program part reviews and Failure Review Board meetings, identify trends, assist in problem resolution, and ensure responsible parties meet commitments. Participate as an active member of Preliminary Material Review Boards and potentially Material Review Boards which includes dispositioning non-conforming hardware in SAP, identifying hardware containment requirements, identifying appropriate root cause and corrective action is taken to prevent recurrence. Perform and Participate in assessments and audits on processes and procedures to ensure compliance to specifications, engineering drawings, procedures and ISO-9001 / AS9100. Interface with customers, suppliers, and program personnel on quality related issues. Utilize lean initiatives to reduce waste and maintain continuous improvement. Work closely with suppliers and production teams to set up new processes, work contractual requirements, obtain corrective action, and provide technical liaison support. Make the final decision on acceptability of product by using measurement tools, drawings and creating and reviewing work instructions. The position requires previous quality engineering or technical experience in developing and reviewing quality standards, drawings, methods, work instructions and procedures for the production of manufactured and procured products. Failure troubleshooting throughout the production process. Individual should be a self-starter who can work autonomously with minimal direction in a fast-paced dynamic environment. Facilitation of and presentation in meetings will be required weekly. Collaborate with Engineering, Manufacturing, Subcontracting, Program Management, Suppliers, and Customer to ensure quality standards are implemented and being met throughout the production process. Analyze program, quality process, and supplier performance, identify adverse trends, understands / identifies risks and drives effective corrective action as well as overall process improvements. This position will require approximately 25% - 30% travel. A level 1 employee typically has 0-2 years of professional experience with a Bachelor degree at a minimum. Basic Qualifications: Electrical Engineering Degree at the Bachelor level from an accredited college/ university Must be U.S. Citizen and able to obtain and maintain a Secret security clearance Ability to obtain a security clearance Proficient skill level with Microsoft Office applications: Word, Excel, Power Point, Access, etc. Thorough and detail-oriented focus with strong analytical skills Strong organizational skills and the ability to work in a dynamic environment Strong communication skills (both oral and written) Ability to Work Individually and as a Team Player Ability to travel 25% - 30% The candidate must be a US citizen. Desired Skills: Ability to Interpret Drawings, Specifications, Contracts Understanding of Geometric, Dimension, & Tolerancing Demonstrate Understanding of Audit Techniques Engineering or Quality Assurance Experience Experience in Dispositioning Non-conformances Experience with Process Capability Analysis Lean/Six Sigma Green or Black Belt Certification Test Engineering, Test Equipment Experience Experience with Production Operations Experience with AS9102 First Article Inspection Experience with AS9145 APQP & PPAP Understanding in AS9100 and ISO 9001 Quality Management Systems Security Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration. Clearance Level: Secret Other Important Information You Should Know Expression of Interest: By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings. Ability to Work Remotely: Part-time Remote Telework: The employee selected for this position will work part of their work schedule remotely and part of their work schedule at a designated Lockheed Martin facility. The specific weekly schedule will be discussed during the hiring process. Work Schedules: Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits. Schedule for this Position: 4x10 hour day, 3 days off per week Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Staff Supplier Quality Engineer (SQE)/Arlington, TX - job post LOCKHEED MARTIN CORPORATION 9,160 reviews Arlington, TX 76018 Full-time, Part-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Part-time Lockheed Martin is seeking an experienced Supplier Quality Engineer (SQE) Staff based in Arlington, TX supporting the PAC-3 program. The Quality professional will be responsible for the strategic leadership and performance; specifically, supplier(s) performance, continuous improvement, talent development, training and knowledge continuity. The candidate will act as a Subject Matter Expert in Supplier Quality Engineering and as an Adviser for the Quality team. This position requires that the candidate stay current with industry standards, solutions and leverage technology into Missile & Fire Control (MFC). Duties include, but are not limited to: Working with Supplier Quality Field Engineers, first article inspection, Production Process Baseline, surveillance, and product line validations as outlined by AS9102 and applicable company and industry standards, special process survey scheduling Support efforts for new/redesigned hardware, including representing quality during design review and supplier selections Participate (as required) in supplier's failure / diagnosis and Material Review Board (MRB) activities Provide technical liaison support related to quality engineering matters Ensure supplier contract flow-down requirements are implemented and verified and interfaces with supplier daily Drive strategies resulting in optimal business methods and practices for strengthening the Quality Management System and talent development Develop and implement processes to optimize program execution while driving out risks Collaborate with Integrated Product Teams and Supplier Management Teams to ensure quality standards are in place Utilize quality methodologies and Missiles and Fire Control policies and procedures Identifying solutions to complex problems with a focus on continual improvement practices using tools like Causal Analysis to drive Corrective Action and Preventive Action Basic Qualifications: Technical Engineering degree at the Bachelor level or above in one of the following disciplines: Aerospace, Mechanical, Electrical, or Industrial Engineering Must have a final Secret security clearance with an investigation within the last 5 years Demonstrated understanding of audit techniques A strong understanding of Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T) Must have knowledge and understanding of critical design attributes Strong understanding of engineering requirements and mechanical and electrical inspection methods – ability to interpret drawings, specifications, contracts that will enable development and review of QE Processes, and related Performance Metrics Experience with performing First Article Inspections to AS9102 requirements Experience with control and disposition of non-conforming Material (Material Review Board) Capable of performing root cause analysis and identifying solutions to complex problems utilizing causal analysis tools - must be able to identify and document supplier’s quality deficiencies and ensure effective corrective actions are identified and implemented An understanding and knowledge of special processes and an overall understanding of how to manage and interface with suppliers daily to support the Program Strong organizational skills and the ability to work in a dynamic environment Strong communication skills (both oral and written) Must be able to effectively communicate and interact with Suppliers, Quality Program Management, Technical Operations, Manufacturing, Government Representatives, and other stakeholders Ability to travel 25% - 50% Desired Skills: A basic understanding of the MFC SAP and P2P business systems ASQ Certification or Lean Six Sigma Certification (Green Belt/Black Belt) Experience with source inspection, surveillance activities and special process at suppliers Advanced AS9100, AS9102 and TS 16949 Interpretation and application experience Experienced as a team lead and facilitator Experience with J-STD-001 IPC-610 inspections Security Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration. Senior Quality Engineer (QE) - Grand Prairie, TX - job post LOCKHEED MARTIN CORPORATION 9,160 reviews 1701 W Marshall Dr, Grand Prairie, TX 75051 Full-time, Part-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Part-time Lockheed Martin is seeking a Quality Engineer for a position based in Grand Prairie, TX. The position requires electrical engineering experience developing and reviewing quality standards, methods, work instructions and procedures for the inspection of manufactured and procured products. Responsibilities include: Reviews documentation related to internal and external manufacturing processes to ensure quality products are delivered to the customer. Supports Supplier IPT’s and various production sites with reviews of quality data on yields, rework, scrap and non-conformance aging. Ability to analyze and resolve process issues varying from basic to very complex. Attends and leads program corrective action meeting, identifies trends, assists in problem resolution and insures responsible parties meet commitments. Participates as an active member of Material Review Boards and Failure Review Boards which includes dispositioning non-conforming hardware, identifying hardware containment requirements, identifying appropriate root cause and corrective action is taken to prevent recurrence. Evaluate the design assurance activities and implementation of production process methodology to prevent impacts to production velocity and quality. Interfaces with customers, suppliers and program personnel on quality related issues. Utilizes lean initiatives to reduce waste and maintain continuous improvement. Makes the final decision on acceptability of product. Level 3 candidates typically have between 5-10 years of experience. Senior Components Engineer /Quality Engr/Supplier/ Arlington, TX - job post LOCKHEED MARTIN CORPORATION 9,160 reviews Arlington, TX 76018 Full-time, Part-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Part-time Our mission is clear. At Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control (MFC), we solve complex challenges, advance scientific discovery and deliver innovative solutions to help our customers keep people safe. We take rocket science to the next level and develop systems that protect from both a distance and in close-combat. We are pioneering the future of missile defense and hypersonic technology. And we’re doing it all with a team of incredible employees across the world. Lockheed Martin MFC is seeking a Component Engineer to ensure the quality of the components on complex weapon’s systems that help ensure our nation’s defense. In this critical role, you would lend your expertise in support of the THAADand PAC-3 programs with emphasis on electrical component specifications, military standards and performance specification for Electrical, Electronic and Electro-Mechanical (EEE) components. The position is responsible for ensuring the quality of products transitioning from development to production through evaluation of design assurance activities and implementation of production process methodology to prevent impacts to production velocity and quality. Candidate needs to have a thorough knowledge and understanding of manufacturing quality requirements and be able to evaluate the application of those requirements toward transitioning product, develop plans and solutions to obstacles that may impact successful transition at the component, sub-assembly and final assembly levels. Learn more about the THAAD program here Learn more about the PAC-3 program here Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s comprehensive benefits package here. Basic Qualifications: Must have the ability to obtain a Secret security clearance BS degree in Electrical / Electronic Engineering or equivalent experience / combined education in this field Experience in electrical component failure analysis Demonstrated problem solving skills, including Root Cause Analysis and Corrective Action Planning Experience in microelectronics fabrication and test or equivalent experience Able to develop and apply quality test and inspection methods to turn materials into products Ability to interpret drawings, specifications, contracts that will enable development and review of QE processes, and related performance metrics Ability to interpret electrical schematics, wiring diagrams, product/performance specifications and other systems integration technical data Ability to analyze and resolve process issues varying from basic to very complex Effective interpersonal skills, including team building and collaboration Proficient skill level with Microsoft Office applications including Access Effective communication skills - written, oral, listening, presentation and technical writing. . Ability to work independently with minimal direct supervision in a fast- paced environment Must be able to travel domestically 30%. Desired Skills: •• Familiar with Military Standards 883 and 750 Familiar with MIL-PERF 38534, 38535, 19500 Demonstrated basic understanding of audit techniques Lean / Six Sigma Green or Black Belt certification ASQ Certified Quality Engineer (CQE) and / or Certified Quality Improvement Associate (CQIA) SAP Application Experience: QNOTES, etc. Advanced AS9100 Interpretation/application skills Experience working effectively in a Matrix Management Environment Experience with Product Development Process (PDP) Material Review Board (MRB) experience Machine shop or electronics manufacturing inspection experience Production Parts Approval Process (PPAP) experience Security Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration. Clearance Level: Secret Other Important Information You Should Know Expression of Interest: By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match.
